p: We used publicly available data from Nextstrain [ 38, 39], and from one previously published study [ 40], to calculate annual antigenic advance, which we defined as the mean antigenic distance between strains of a given lineage (pre-2009 H1N1, post-2009 H1N1 or H3N2) that circulated in consecutive seasons ( Methods). The “antigenic distance” between two influenza strains is used as a proxy for similarity in antigenic phenotype, and potential for immune cross-protection. A variety of methods have been developed to estimate antigenic distance using serological data, genetic data, or both [ 39– 41].
